content:
Bei'an
Bei'an (Chinese: 北安; pinyin: Běi'ān; literally: 'northern peace') is a county-level city in west-central Heilongjiang province in the People's Republic of China. It is under the jurisdiction of Heihe.
Bei'an was the provincial capital of Bei'an province of Manchukuo, a puppet state set up by Japan during the Second World War.

Administrative divisions
There are six subdistricts, five towns and four townships under the city's administration:{"citetype": "web", "url ": "http://www.stats.gov.cn/tjbz/cxfldm/2011/23/11/231181.html", "scripttitle ": "zh:2011\u5e74\u7edf\u8ba1\u7528\u533a\u5212\u4ee3\u7801\u548c\u57ce\u4e61\u5212\u5206\u4ee3\u7801\uff1a\u5317\u5b89\u5e02", "publisher ": "National Bureau of Statistics of the People's Republic of China", "language ": "Chinese", "accessdate ": "2013-01-27"}
